metadata.titel_preek: Saints Remembered and Saints to Come

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The congregation must validate the 100-year history of the church by deciding to live lives of faith and mission in the future.

tekstueel_bewijs: You now can determine what this history adds up to.
Decide now to be the people in the future through whom the light of God comes.

object.identificatie: Validation of the past/A better country
tekstueel_bewijs: validate and maximize and enhance the past hundred years
I believe the entire chapter was written in order to get to these two verses
they would not, apart from us, be made perfect
how that counts depends on now

helper.identificatie: The Example of Ancestors/God's provision of water
tekstueel_bewijs: sturdy folk in this church have always trusted
God will give drink to God’s chosen people
wishing for the good old days
Many of us fear the other
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The primary obstacles are internal attitudes like nostalgia or lack of resolve rather than ontological sin or cosmic evil.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God doing a 'new thing' in the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: God's action (Program 2) provides the setting/opportunity for the congregation's action (Program 1).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Preacher/Tradition → Validation of History → Past Saints

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is doing a new thing
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You now can determine what this history adds up to.
Decide now to be the people...
We connected spirit and church and saints.

voorbeelden: the church must consciously, deliberately turn its face
Saints are people who know the primal language
if you know what I mean
gives this present generation the capacity
God help me to be one too

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily weighted toward obligation and human decision. It assumes the hearer has the power to act if they simply choose to.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Past memories) to S1 (Call to future faith) via the negation of S2 (Do not remember former things).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through human decision ('Decide now').
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a psychological trap rather than a spiritual death.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using the language of 'faith,' the sermon's engine is anthropocentric. The value of God's past work is made contingent upon human performance ('Everything is up to you').

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The value of the first hundred years in the eyes of God depends upon what is done now.
Decide now to be the people...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Behold I am doing a new thing

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Saints are defined by their attributes (light-bearers, kind, brave) and the congregation is told to emulate them.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God was faithful to Abraham despite his failures; God will be faithful to this church.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform to 'save' the church's legacy.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where man completes what God started.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The bowling analogy provides a strong but theologically problematic coherence.
spanning_punten: The claim that God's approval of ancestors depends on the current generation's success.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: saints are the ones through whom the light comes upon us

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is mentioned as 'renewing' but the sermon focuses on the human 'deciding'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'copping out' or 'nostalgia' rather than a condition requiring a Savior.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a recruitment speech. The congregation is the Subject, and God is the Helper/Provider of resources.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The congregation is the subject of the 'perfecting' of the church.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God as the one who perfects the saints.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: God, who began a good work in this church 100 years ago, is the one who will bring it to completion.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the 'promises received' rather than the 'decisions made'.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the 'Easter gift' actually enables the weary to walk.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Address the impossibility of being 'saints' by our own will.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a 'heavy' opponent, grace is not necessary, only effort.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a wonderful heart for the community, but it places the burden of 100 years of history on the shoulders of the congregation rather than on the faithfulness of Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the bowling analogy is effective; semiotically, it is Pelagian.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Hebrews 11:40 usually emphasizes Christ as the 'perfecter,' not the later congregation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Object' (the church's legacy) is being held hostage by the 'Subject' (the congregation).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the word 'faith' frequently, but defines it as 'willingness to trust' and 'readiness to risk,' making faith itself a human work/competence.
